page.title: 01 CRAIGLUSCAR
page.content: AREA 03040690 CRAIGLUSCAR LIES 3km TO THE NORTH_WEST OF DUNFERMLINE AND 2km EAST OF THE VILLAGE OF SALINE IN WEST FIFE. THE AREA CONSISTS OF UNDULATING RELIEF RANGING FROM 122m IN THE SOUTH_EAST TO 227m AT CRAIGLUSCAR HILL IT IS AN AGRICULTURAL AREA WITH MAINLY GRASS AND ROUGH GRAZING. THE GRASS IS WIDELY USED FOR GRAZING WITH SOME BEING USED FOR FODDER.THE DEVILLA FOREST IN THE SOUTH WEST OF THE AREA IS DOMINATED BY CONIFEROUS TREES. IN THE AREA NORTH WEST OF WELLWOOD LIES THE REFUSE TIP.AND TO THE NORTH WEST OF THE TIP LIE CRAIGLUSCAR RESEVOIRS. THESE CONSIST OF THREE RESEVOIRS WHICH ARE WIDELY USED BY MANY ANGLERS AND HAVE A LARGE SCALE OF WILDLIFE AROUND THEM.
